intro: Capsella, commonly known as mouse-ear or common mouse-ear, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its small, herbaceous growth habit and distinctive, oval-shaped leaves that resemble mouse ears. The flowers are typically small, white or pale purple, and arranged in racemes. Capsella species are often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and fields. They are also known for their ability to produce numerous seeds, contributing to their widespread distribution.
